column4: So I updated to Maverick for some reason, it gripes about my CPU being insecure, then drops into tty1
Anyone have a great way to fix this, or am I going to have to grope it until it finishes and works
the message about the CPU is probably not related to your other problem
Is the message you're seeing this?: "Your CPU appears to be lacking expected security protections."
Yep.
then that's a separate issue from your video issues - that message began in lucid as far as I know
I haven't seen it before. But yeah, I'll ignore it. So why's it dropping me into tty1 if all it's telling me is that message?
don't know about that - I just knew that the CPU message was not related :-)
hopefully that saves you from chasing a red herring
probably not - I'm just saying *I* don't know - you might provide more details about it?
there are regressions with nVidia cards - I have one, which is why I'm skipping Maverick
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/maverick/+source/nvidia-graphics-drivers/+bug/616023
Thanks much. It says "fix released"... would that have already been in the update repository? I just installed today.
possibly... you're able to update okay, right?
yep. I can access all tty layers, too. As if I booted then pressed ctrl-alt-f1
hmm, so it's not freezing or anything, it just skips GDM and goes straight to TTY1?
Correct.
have you checked the logs for any messages about video?
There are thousands.
grep -c will count the lines returned, if that's what you mean
I want the line number in the file
grep -n
